[{settingsDocs}]

You can change your local settings here, such as date and time, language, and country. Ok, thats mostly a lie. So far, you can only change the time that displays in the Epicenter nodelet, but this is a nice place for those other rarely requested features to appear. Someday.

[{openform}]

The Epicenter nodelet show the server time. You can optionally set your offset from that time. Currently, only the Epicenter time is changed, but later writeups and other timed things will reflect this setting, too.
No matter what your offset, the vote reset is midnight, server time.
To use the time zone offset, first check "use my time zone offset", then choose your time zone offset from the list. If you are currently in daylight saving time, check that box, too. (Be sure to then hit the submit button; we haven't installed MindReader.pm yet.)
[{varcheckbox:localTimeUse,Use my time zone offset}], as set below
time offset (hours:minutes) [% #going by what the time() function uses: base unit is seconds my $MIN30 = 1800; my $params=''; #problem is that daylight saving time messes this whole thing up; cheap way is to have a separate checkbox for daylight saving time my %specialNames = ( '-10:00'=>'Hawaii', '-9:00'=>'Alaska', '-8:00'=>'Pacific (Tijuana/Los Angeles/Vancouver)', '-7:00'=>'Mountain (Calgary/Denver/Salt Lake City)', '-6:00'=>'Central (Winnipeg/Chicago/New Orleans)', '-5:00'=>'Eastern (New York City/Atlanta/Miami)', '-4:00'=>'Atlantic (Halifax/Caracas/Santiago)', '-3:30'=>'Newfoundland', '-3:00'=>'Greenland/Rio de Janeiro/Buenos Aires', '0:00'=>'UTC server time - United Kingdom (London)', '1:00'=>'Central Europe', '2:00'=>'Eastern Europe/Jerusalem/Cape Town', '3:00'=>'Moscow/Baghdad', '7:00'=>'Bangkok/Hanoi', '8:00'=>'Beijing/Hong Kong/Singapore/Perth', '9:00'=>'Tokyo/Seoul', '9:30'=>'Adelaide/Darwin', '10:00'=>'Guam/Sydney/Melbourne', '11:00'=>'Brisbane', '13:00'=>'Fiji/New Zealand/Antarctica', # ''=>'', ); local *timeit = sub { #ugh ugh ugh my ($raw) = @_; $raw=int($raw/60); my $posPart; my $isNeg; if($raw<0) { $posPart=-$raw; $isNeg=1; } else { $posPart=$raw; $isNeg=0; } my $onRight=$posPart % 60; my $onLeft = int(($posPart-$onRight)/60); $onRight='0'.$onRight unless length($onRight)==2; my $cur = ($isNeg ? '-' : '') . $onLeft . ':' . $onRight; $cur .= ' - ' . $specialNames{$cur} if exists $specialNames{$cur}; return $cur; }; my $t; for(my $i=-30;$i<=30;++$i) { #actually, +/- 24 is the real limit, but maybe some people live in really really really weird time zones (or, more likely, the server time goes really wonky again) $t = $i * $MIN30; #don't trust adding using Perl's non-integer math; at least this way, the damage will be contained $params .= ',' . $t .
